metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6090 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the expand function in os/pl-glob.c in SWI-Prolog before 6.2.5 and 6.3.x before 6.3.7 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

swi-prolog - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
swi-prolog-bdb - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
swi-prolog-java - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
swi-prolog-nox - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
swi-prolog-odbc - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
swi-prolog-x - 6.6.4-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: swi-prolog package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.4-2ubuntu1').
